comments.text: Instant ride to Copenhagen after 10 minutes!
A German bus with a Group of young students offered us a ride after around 10 minutes :)

Agree with the both commenting before. A lot of trucks are resting here. I asked two and got a ride with the second to a great place outside of Varberg. Took me less than five minutes at about noon a sunny day in november. I'd use this place again for sure!
absolutly the best spot if you want to go south from gothenburg!
was waiting here for about 20 min, but got a ride straight to malm√∂, great spot.

Kind of place where you can be a bit demanding on the destination. After 20 min i refuse 3 cars for overkalix and morjarv . After 30... Finally someone that was going to Kiruna ! I couldn't hope for more. You can also durectly ask at the gasstation but and find a car event faster, but for long distance like this i prefer someone that's really choose to take me.
Great spot picked up a ride in less than 5 min all the way to kiruna
Car density is pretty low, but even though we got a ride in just half an hour, but we were lucky. I can imagine, that we could spent here a lot of time.

(Winter) Direction South. Good spot even in Winter at night, got a ride to Pite√• in about an hour, there is the petrol station and a restaurant where you may ask people but our ride came out of the road.
Hitched here in summer 2010, waited around 5 min in daylight, with a sign GVE, got a straight ride to G√É¬§llivare.
Ride to lovanger, about 30min. Good spot.
It's a good spot indeed, but it's still has some local traffic so we waited a while.

Summer/ Dir South

ALOT of room for cars and even trucks to stop!
Bus stop. There crossing with traffic lights right just before. Cars are going slow and density is high.

Perfect spot to go south. You can probably find someone who takes you very far, so maybe don't take the first person who only goes 30 kilometers to Nyk√∂ping (because it is very hard to get away from there).
Tumbed at the exit
Got a ride to Malm√∂ in 20 min, lots of cars to ask.

Theres a nice little pull off here if heading West.  Got a ride from here to Trondheim in about 5 seconds.  Probably really good luck, but also lots of traffic will be going that way and it should be easy anyway.
Never waited more than 5-10 minutes getting a ride from here to √Öre, hitched this a few times, with a sign, in December.
Big rest area with a petrol station, toilets, and options to camp. Good for getting a ride to Malm√∂ or Denmark. At the petrol station you can charge your phone and sit.

August, Southbound, 10AM
First car offered me a ride to Malm√∂, second car took me to Copenhagen.
There is a really nice camping spot 30 minutes from here. Walk across the bridge, and hop the fence at the gasstation on the other side of the highway. There is a little trail that you can follow for +-20 minutes, which brings you to a little forest near some houses, right next to lake R√•sj√∂. Awesome
The first people we asked took us to malm√∂. A very good spot
Highly recommending this spot. Everyone goes towards Stockholm from this roundabout and there‚Äôs easily time and room to stop your car. It‚Äôs 9 o‚Äôclock so there‚Äôs lots of work traffic.

All traffic going straight on the roundabout is literally going towards Stockholm. Waited 7 minutes for a ride, while traffic Saturday morning in Januari. Close to busstop "Uppsala Business Park", easy to park a bike there and Swebus (Stockholm - Uppsala for 59 SEK) stops there.
Really good spot. Don't accept a ride shorter then √ñrnsk√∂ldsvik. All the spots between these 2 are REALLY bad. But this spot is awesome so much traffic.
Awesome spot. Separate line for buses, good visibility, there is also a fast food, where lot of lorry drivers stop, so you can try one of them.
Yeah it's a great fuel station.

I needed a while to get a lift to Stockholm, but then a trucker picked me up and drove me directly to the ferry harbour I wa going to.. There is good traffic so there is always somebody to ask which keeps you from desperation. 
Good luck, God bless you!
Petrol station with lots of traffic going north and southward bound. Good spot!
The spot is very good indeed, we wait one hour because we went in the direction of the coast. But if you want to go south or north, I guess it's a good solution !
I¬¥ve also hitched from this place and it is indeed good. Just a few minutes for me too. A good thing is to use a sign because the spot I was using met cars heading both north, south and east..

Really nice spot, because of the open-every-day mall, which attracts customers all the way from Norway. Found a ride north in minutes. You might actually be (in my case should be) picky about the hitch, so you get some safe distance.
Maybe I just got lucky, but I got a ride to Helsingborg almost immediately. I slept in the nearby field.

I was walking toward the on ramp in Helsinborg direction and waving at cars and to my surprise, one of them actually stopped. Also, there is a comfortable field by trees nearby for sleeping if arrive late to this place.
Very nice spot with plenty of place for a car to stop
We wanted to go to Goteborg, but we caught a ride to Halmstad instead, wron where I believe it will be much easier to go to GTB :)

Little space to pull over except a crappy bit of grass, but it worked! Hitching direct from the on ramp, ride in 15 mins north to Gothenburg. Boom. What was that about Sweden being crap for hitchhiking?
An excellent spot if you go to Malmo. Cars go slow and someone will pick you very soon.
I was hoping to get to Karlstad, but the very first car stopped and offered to get me halfway. Good spot
Many cars heading towards Karlstad.
Huge rest area with a shop and restaurant. There is also a parking lot for trucks.
Got a ride to Abisco, rain and big backpack helped :)
Got a ride to Abisco, rain and big backpack helped :)
Hitch hiked from here twice towards Malm√∂. Once with 4 people and once alone. I would recommend to stand at the side of the ramp so you can stop cars comming from east and west.

If you're going in the direction of J√∂nk√∂ping, standing at this bus stop is probably preferable, since much of traffic at the fuel station seemed to be going the opposite direction. There is space and cars weren't driving to fast. We got a ride towards Stockholm in 2 min. Probably better to get of here if you're heading to Stockholm than to try change cars in J√∂nk√∂ping.
This place worked great for me and a girl who was also hitchhiking from here when I arrived. Space to stop at the bus stop. We we're going in the direction of J√∂nk√∂ping.
Great hh spot.  Also good camping spots nearby.
the old spot, now only local traffic since the new highway part was built

there is a bus stop. I'm not quiet sure if it is a good spot, cos the cars a passing are really fast so you need a bit of luck. Anyway I only waited arround 10 minutes.
22.08.2015
Great spot!  I had a ride in 30 seconds.  Good place for drivers to pull off into the bus lane and they're going slow since coming out of the round about.

Great to stand right at this spot so road traffic can pull into the petrol station to pick you up.  I had a ride here from a DHL truck within 2 minutes of standing here.  Much busier than the other petrol station 500 meters away.

We were three guys hitchhiking to Malm√∂, there's a lot of cars passing by after plane arrivals, so I would say it's good spot to hitchhike. A DHL guy picked up us after 40 minutes and took us to center of Malm√∂.
it was magnificent, after 5 minutes!
I asked maybe five cars for a maximum of ten minutes and got a ride to Falkenberg! At noon on a sunny day in november. Great place!
Statoil and a McDonald's almost side to side, right by the freeway. Easy to be dropped at and easy to get rides from.
outside of the hotel. Pretty good and countrysite ppl are kind and know that there are almost no busses. Might be difficult in winter.

SUmer 2014, I hitched here from Storuman in only a few hours. Daytime, workday, female single traveller. Very easy. Plus the next day I hitched from Saxn√§s to Klimpfj√§ll and back, even to Fatmomakke and back. No problem to get rides. The locals are kind and people know there are almost no busses going. Friendly folks in northern sweden countryside. On a sunday, I hitched back to VIlhelmina. Pretty difficult as not many cars and the ones which came were full. Normal on sunday when they do their f

Busstop "Mont√∂rv√§gen". Busses which stop there are scarce, so you can take bus 2 (Direction Nacksta) to near there (get off after the big right curve) and just walk the few meters and stand somewhere along the road before the long road leads into a countryside - motorway kind of thing. Easy to get a lift, however long way from the E4 if you need to change. I only waited about 10mins there. Daytime, summer, female single traveller
Late July 2014. Equipped with sign "G√∂teborg" me and a friend got a ride within 20 min all the way to G√∂teborg.
Great spot. Before the roundabout. Difficult for cars to stop but everyone see you.
Bus stop right behind the fusion of west- and eastcoast-road, so maybe the most traffic on the island :D
Bus stop on the main street on both sides, so easy to stop for cars.

To Kalmar/south of the island: There's a huge bus stop with much space to stop for people. Cars are slow because coming from traffic lights and there's a tempo limit of 50 still. Drivers might see you late, so walk a bit down the bus stop, they have more reaction time than. It's the main road on √ñland, so there's plenty of cars.
E22 (Kalmar): Never ending traffic (and slow, because of the traffic lights) and a lane on the E22 where cars can stop. Perfect spot to get south.

To E22: A long parking lot for cars to stop. They can see you while waiting on the traffic lights, also they are very slow and the cars going on the E22 are on the lane next to the parking lot, so easy to stop for them. Make sure to stay not directly to the traffic lights, because then cars coming from Dagsbergsv√§gen only see you when it's already too late. Many many traffic here.
Nice spot to get to Katrineholm/Norrk√∂ping. Cars have to drive slow because of the camera, and there's a bus stop to hold for them a few meters before the camera.
bus stop right behind radar control, so cars are slow and have a place to stop. many traffic, so we got a ride to karlstadt after a few minutes.

at the roundabout there is a good spot to get on the e45 in both directions, because cars almost can only get there from here (except some locals going right or left ;)). cars can stop on the big parking lot directly after the right exit of the roundabout.

zebra crossing for the highschool of trollhattan. many pedestrians there, so the cars have to stop all the time or they are at least very slow. bus stop after the zebra crossing is a perfect place to get in the stopping car. expect to get strange looks from the locals.. but it was very funny.
good spot right on the e18. traffic is slow because of the traffic lights and there is a good place to stop for them (bus stop). you can also ask people at the gas station nearby.

Great spot to head North to Norway. All of the traffic is Norwegians going to the cheaper swedish shop just across the border to buy groceries and cigarettes. Stock up on food here too as is half the price of Norway.

none of the 3 others left a description. so according to google maps there should be space to stand. I will try this on a weekday morning to see if thats right. take the bus 59 to "Haga station". lets see
Southwards: Not too much space to stop, but a lot of traffic and the cars are driving slowly. Got a ride to Copenhagen after 10 mins. I reckon afternoon and just before weekend is good.
Doesn't look like a good spot to hh, but with a good sign, and smiley faces we (couple) caught a ride to Malm√∂ in 10 mins.
Great spot both ways for Stockholm/J√§rna and M√∂rk√∂! Its not very , veyr busy road, but always first or second car picks you up!
Great spot! Always waiting less than 10minutes!

Great spot! There is a bus stop,so, plenty of space for cars to stop. Always works when need to go to Gnesta and other smaller places. Also the other side of rode can work well, but better is to walk down to other hh spots for STHLM and South!
Good spot to get to the lake V√§stra Ringsj√∂n via Orman√§s/Stanstorp where you'll find spots to camp.

yes... just talk to the ppl in the petrol station. 
most of them going south there but you can get as well good rides to north 
I get in Stockholm directly from here.
very very nice.
p.s. ignore the swedish snob/dumb ppl . speak to DK cars ;) they understand more.
Stood just at the exit from the truck-stop with a sign and managed to get a ride in about 5 minutes. A lot of cars stopping here going South. Got a ride to Helsingborg.
asked truck drivers on the car deck before the ferry arrived in the harbour, got a ride directly to J√∂nk√∂ping
Viking terminal, for ferries arriving from Finland. Very good chances of finding a ride to anywhere in sweden, even norway and denmark.

(Winter / Daytime / Direction E4 South) There is a Shell petrol station with somewhat good traffic, behind the petrol station there are some industrial spots with parking places where trucks take breaks, good place to ask for a ride, if not the petrol station should be good enough, but standing in the road next to the train station is a great idea as there cars can see your sign and park at the train station or petrol station, also there is a traffic light that forces them to stop from time to t

(Winter / Night / Direction E4 South) Very good spot as its right next to the E4 and there are 3 petrol stations one after the other, including some restaurants and special pumps for trucks. You can choose where to ask, it took us about half an hour to get a ride to Sundsvall.

(Winter) There is a hotel and some ski related places for tourists where you can stop or get a ride to, from Narvik Norwegians come to shop here so there are chances for a ride up to here and then to stand in the road at the exit from the tourist complex to get a ride. Waited for about an hour and got a ride to Kiruna.

A fuel station just before the road splits to the north, south, and east. In my experience in Sweden it is very rare to be picked up on the roadside, but if you can be friendly and ask people for a ride then they are quite helpful. This is a great spot.

Awesome place, there is a bus stop so cars got enough space to pick up. 3 cars stops in 20 minutes to help me until highway, I refuse with the smile each time, the 4th was a guy who bring me until Haparanda. I never expect it could be so easy.
Cars go very slow, everyone is smiling at you, so also waiting you have a good time, and eventually an Iraqui guy took me and brought me to the highway despite he was supposed to go in the city!
Really good spot for getting south. I had to get of before the highway split (my driver was going to Oslo) so I walked 500 meter and then waited 10+ minutes before I was picked up.
To go back to Kiruna just stay at the bus stop, or try to ask at the parking of the Ice Hotel
on ramp at road, catch a lift to Stockholm within 5 min
There is a petrol station here with lots of trucks. Ask the drivers, forget about the swedish ppl in the cars, they dont usually bother picking/up somebody. I got a lift to Orebro from there
it took me just 5 minuts to get a ride noth. There√Ç¬¥s a bus stop good to stop and with good visibility

To Oland. It only took me 5 to 10 mins and i was using this spot several times. Use a sign. You can walk there to the bus stop Ango or catch a bus. Its within walking distance from the city and quite much traffic, no trucks though.

I tried hitching from here at about 10:00am on a Friday morning.  I got offered three rides to Malm√É¬∂ within about 15 minutes (I rejected the first two because I was trying to get to K√É¬∏benhavn, and didn't think Malm√É¬∂ would help much at first).
pull-off, rest area with a petrolstation and a small foodplace. was dropped here and found a new ride faster than 5minutes.
Got a lift after just a few minutes. There are places like this all along the E45 so do take shorter rides as well.

This is a gasstation just after a speedcamera which ensures that the cars drive slowly and there is plenty of space for them to stop.
Waiting time: ~45 min //Denizo
Hitched from here in summer 2010, waited no more than 15 min. in daylight, got a long ride up north.
We had a first-car-stop... Nice busstop and cars driving up the hill slowly...
Car are a bit fast, but very good traffic and HUGE place to pull over. So perfect spot to go to upsala.
Good classic spot
Probably you could catch a long ride from this perfect spot. But after 10min i just took a ride to the end of the city to continue south.
TONs of traffic w/ Norwegians going to the city after harryhandel. Raining hard and some lady took pity on me and picked me up near-instantly, but I don‚Äôt expect it would take long otherwise

One male 40+, one big and one small backpacks, a rainy (drizzle) day. Going to Stockholm.
A very good spot. An exit from lorry stop (some custom place) good visibility and enough space even for a lorry to stop. Not very busy road, a few cars per minut.
I didn't wait at all. I just stopped and I was about to take the sign out from my backpack, whe first lorry leaving the custom car park stopped and took me all the way to Stockholm. The fact that I was wearing a t-shirt with a big Polish emblem
Best hhing spot north from Sundsvall!
Got chased on my walk to the road by a guy who took me here on my way to Ume√•, much easier to get rides here than in Sweden I think
Guys from my last ride just went and asked a truckie if I could ride with him lol, was pretty wicked. Got all the way to √ñstersund

Bus stop to hitchhack to Lysekil and see the pink rocks even if they are more beautifull in Bretagne üòâ
Did not wait long
I think we were just very very lucky, just as we started stoping some lady pick us up and take us stright to our destination :)
The best spot in Sundsvall for the E4 south. Large space to stop on the onramp with all the traffic from the E14

Gas station and rest area ‚Äì a perfect spot for both northbound and southbound directions! Many cars heading to Oslo and Gothenburg, and one was even going all the way back to Serbia. Ask people at the gas station and in the charging area. I got a ride to Oslo.
Perfect spot, close to a rest area and a gas station. I got a short ride to Uddevalla.

Sunday morning, solo female, sign for E4/north, on the entrance to the gas station. Not many people stop for gas, but all the cars that go through the road can stop. Got a ride inmediately, Belgian campervan, to Sundsvall.
Slow speed, good visibility, parking spots behind enable safe stopping - although the truck that picked me up didn't care about these.
Waited for drivers leaving the parking area of the supermarket. They're almost all going down to Norway (hh in August 2025)

Caught a ride to Mora from here, there is a petrol station which is quite busy and even standing by the road with s sign works. Many people going to Mora  or further north. I caught a ride with a German van. Much love and good luck hitchingüåª
Asked the truck drivers at the diesel station for the trucks.
A woman picked us up to Malm√∂
A guy picked us on his way back home from IKEA

We were about to give up and go to eat McDonalds 40 minutes away on foot, but a really nice girl saw us being in misery,  approached us and asked if we need a ride. We wanted to reach Oslo, she drove us a little bit over Undelvalla :) (couple)

Hi! I'm a Swedish journalist working on a piece about hitchhiking. Are you currently (or have recently) hitchhiked through western Sweden? Then I want to interview you! Send med an email on klara.larsson@bohuslaningen.se . Happy travels!

Hi! I'm a Swedish journalist working on a piece about hitchhiking. Are you currently (or have recently) hitchhiked through western Sweden? Then I want to interview you! Send med an email on klara.larsson@bohuslaningen.se . Happy travels!

Hi! I'm a Swedish journalist working on a piece about hitchhiking. Are you currently (or have recently) hitchhiked through western Sweden? Then I want to interview you! Send med an email on klara.larsson@bohuslaningen.se . Happy travels!
We wanted to go to Goteborg to start catching a ride to Oslo, it was raining but we managed to hop in quickly with backpacks (couple)
really quick, the guy had seen us run after the bus and was already planning on offering a ride
Summer 2025, 18:20, a friendly woman from Germany stoped
Summer 2025, 17:40, very friendly people in the villages
Summer 2025, 9:30 a.m. , very friendly people.  Even 2 cars stopped in the first 13 min
A very good spot for going to Lund. I got ride in 10min with Lund sign. It is a small bus stop and there is enough space for cars to stop.
3 cars stopped in a short time, maybe everybody was heading home after work, a nice swedish man picked me up because he tried to hitchhike when he was young( though failed)..
Best place to be. Church member from Stockholm who visited √ñrebro and was willing to take me back.

Easily visible, wide exit of the roundajout. Cars can stop while other traffik can still pass by. Also very clear which direvtion you want to go to by standing next to the sign. Seems like a very promising spot. Guy lived countryside and used to hitchhike to school during his youth, took me to my final destination direction, stunning honestly.

Insanely lucky, asked around at the gas station for a ride to Avesta, tested my luck at a busstop. First truck driver pulled over, drove me to the highway intersection with lots of traffik towards V√§ster√•s and Avesta. Although this (bus)stop isn't great for Avesta, I think it's quite promising with traffik going from Uppsala to other destinations.

Asked around at the gasstation first, but realised the busstop was perfect considering the huge amount of traffik. Made a sign with '70' to make sure any traffik going right on the roundabout would just ignore me. Guy going to play golf near Sala thought hitchhikers were cool and offered me a ride. Was already quite tired, so loved to just have someone to talk to while slowly creeping towards my destination near Avesta.
Wide shoulder for going towards V√§steras, lots of traffic, got a ride within 20 minutes, speeds are slow

First major service station in north, but I still decided to just hitchhike at entrance and it worked very well, just about the right amount of traffic and cars go very slow, good shoulder for them to stop, possibility to get real long rides towards south, wait time of 10 minutes, and almost every car reacted friendly that didn't pick up

Great spot, both by the road as well as asking around in this parking lot, lots of trucks and mainly getting fuel or food, got a ride offer to Finland within 10 minutes and within 40 minutes got truck going a long distance to south, probably best spot for long distance rides anywhere around here
Amazing spot for going southbound, very wide shoulder that is asphalted, speeds are slow and decent visibility, lots of cars from here go the least to Pitea, wait time of 5 minutes
Perfect if going south. There is a perfect bus stop for cars to stop but it doesn't appear on the map. Got a ride very quickly.

Got a lift to Karesuando by 10 mins.
I was lucky. Low traffic
A large petrol station and also a supermarket parking. Many people driving long distance.
Missed a train and walked here, despite having luggage, got a car immediately, but not that much of traffic, wait time of 5 minutes
Got a ride to Sundsvall in about 20 min using a sign. Friday evening. Safe spot, good visibility.
Space to stop and lot of traffics
Good traffics, not so much place to stop. Get a ride to Kalix
Great place, much place to pull over and great visibility. It is in the city so cars go slow but nearly everybody stays on the highway.
We talked to people at the electric vehicle charging station, and directly found a nice couple who took us very far south.
Bus stop with ok visibility/speed and place to pull over. Ride to Falkenberg. English speaking driver.

Great spot for evening ride since the traffic is not that heavy at that time. A bit stopover place. the spot is the resemble of highway and torp city road. definitely the best place if you are desperate at night
Bus stop, good visibility and plenty space. Going south
Plenty place for cars to park
Nice spot where cars are moving slowly due to the camera on the road and enough space for them to safely stop
Very good spot, lot of passage going to Malm√∂. Go under the bridge there is a spot for cars to stop.

Totally agree with Chris about that bus stops near highways are better than gas station in Sweden.
This gas station worked well for me, got a ride north to Halmstad. I was hitchhiking at the entrance of the gas station.

got a 45 mins walk and found this spot looking at my MapsMe map. During 20 minutes 2 cars stopped - the 1st one was going to Linkoping, the next one to Angelholm, my direction south.
The spot is alright, possible to stay there, enough space to pull over, but some cars are going fast, but still alright in my opinion.

A perfect place BUT not much traffic even I got a short ride with the local kids to Kungalv.
At this spot there is a good place for camping if you got stuck on the night.

This spot is perfect if you go north despite I spent around 3 hours there (because of Sunday evening). There is a small gas station, and electrical charges there, a place for camping too. I was hitch hiking right after the roundabout during the darkness ang got a ride. The car was going to Ski, I got off in Sarpsborg.
Seemed like a bad spot with only a little hard shoulder, but people did pullover, traffic slow, solid visibility. Onwards north. English driver. Yay!

Walking along the residential road, small hard shoulder and a little slow traffic, the 1st car stopped and took me all the way to malmo! Driver was nice and spoke perfect English. 7am in morning. Solo male.

Easy free ride out of ume, hitching from ume is waste of time and this option is recommended. Get on any train that goes to h√∂rnefors which is next stop south after ume√• √∂stra. Go to the other side of the train from staff and they will not have time to check ur ticket. (If they would, just get off at h√∂rnefors anyways, they might get mad but won't do anything.
Busy rest area at the arctic circle.
A lot of space to stop, good traffic. Didn't take long to get a ride. Calm and beatiful places to sleep

Oh damn was I lucky! I was going with a sign to Karlstad along the road and a van instantly stopped by. Took me almost directly to Stockholm! The place is overall pretty nice, a lot of space to pull over for the whole road + a bus stop. You will definitely get a ride here

Towards Finland. 
Speed limit is 110 but you are visable from a good distance. There's a bus stop, so place to stop for drivers and shelter for you. More traffic than the onramp near the town

We went to south with sign G√∂teborg. There is some place behind the roundabound. If you go opposite way, There is near another roundabound where it is possible, too.
Many people go home to Village around, so it is not easy to find someone going further. But better to get to some Gas station than nothing. üòä

Popular hotel and view point. A lot of cars going both north and south stop there to enjoy the view or get a snack. I spent the night camping near the water and got a ride in the morning from the very first car passing me.
Gas station, plenty of traffic. After 45 mins of asking around got a ride to Lulea.
Parking, lot of tourist going south, lot of van and CAMPERVAN, few trucs. Very easy to have a long distance ride, if you go early even maybe all the way to Stokholm.

Summer 2023. Ask to the people After they took gas. The second car accept ! 
They all go at least to Tore. Probably eazy to go until Kiruna. Lot of norvegian car if you want to increase your chance of long distance :)
First person i asked took us (2 people) to the city center in g√∂teborg. As well there is a toilette on the resting place.

intersection of 2 roads, kinda in the middle of nowhere, but after 10 mins a car going to Oslo stopped.
At this spot the cars turn from E10 to E45.
I was standing right at the entrance where cars have to stop and give way. It's not the best place, but there's no better in the area heading north.

For Sweden this is a very good spot. Lots of truck drivers that you can ask directly. They are usually very friendly and I shared coffee with them.
Got a long distance ride almost all the way to Stockholm! Just be patient as there might be times with barely any traffic - have a snack and wait for the trucks

If you want to ride a really long distance in a short time, the eastern highway is ideal. Many cars and trucks go as far as the Stockholm area or further. With one driver you are able to drive almost the whole of Sweden.
Nice place to hitchhike into G√∏teborg. Got a ride after 10 minutes! (I had a G√ò sign with me)

Great spot, the first time the second car stopped (for a 10km-ride), the second time we got a lift to our destination nyk√∂ping!
good place for going towards the e4 from markaryd (near the tourist information boards), all the way to markaryd there are bus stops at the street

I got an instant ride on the ferry. 

I'm just flexing, I didn't get to know the spot.
Easy to get a lift at least onto the ferry (running almost non stop) to Denmark. Then  you can continue on the other side. Or aks around on the ferry.
Stood somewhere around here with a sign saying "DK", got a lift over the ferry within 15 min. From Helsing√∏r it's very easy to get to Copenhagen.

I mean if you want to get out of airport this is probably the best spot because you also catch the traffic from mcdonalds which turned out good for me because the couple picked me up to goteborg from there.

Really good spot. All traffic heading minimum to bor√•s. To get here from Gbg for free is tricky but possible. Try green express buses to partille. Then just swich bus to landvetter. and then bus 611 (r√§vlanda/bollebygd), stop at "H√§rryda kyrka" and walk to the right on "flygplatsv√§gen". A little bit messy, but works for me, easier than tring to get a ride in the city at least.

Ask for a bus to Ikea to reach close to here (bus stop: St√•ngj√§rnsgatan). Felt like the cars are too fast but in the other hand the curb on the side is wide and we got a ride in 15 minutes. We were on the verge of moving to the beginning of the previous roundabout where I think I saw a busstop. Will happily leave an analysis of that spot for another time. :)
Asked trucks before entering the ferry. Most trucks are afraid they‚Äôre gonna get in trouble by taking you over the border so try not to be suspicious looking. Was there around 5 pm
On the ferry you can ask people in the cars, got at once a ride to rodby. Many people (swedens) go to germany to buy as much beer as there is any space in their cars!
Got a ride near Halmstad, giant space for cars to stop, good visibility, cars a little bit fast but not too much.
Night time hitch to Lund, very good spot.
Had quite a bit of luck, but the spot itself doesn‚Äôt seem ideal. Cars to quite fast

Couple. We got here lift from "prime" spot in Malmo. Got a ride to next station in ~20 minutes. Low traffic.
Got dropped off here. A lot of traffic, but nobody going north toward Helsingborg or Gotenborg. Avoid it if possible in favor of service station a few kms north on E6.

Good spot, decent visibility and people aren't driving fast.
We had no luck here. Very few cars. We walked all the way to the Abisko touriststation without a ride.
There is a lay-in for cars to stop and the cars are not too fast. But most of the cars are pretty full due to the holiday time.
Good spot to ask for a ride at the rest area around the McDonalds. Hitched a ride there at about 17:00 to J√∂nk√∂ping, took me maybe 5 minutes directly asking people.

Were dropped here from Link√∂ping, going south. Big mistake. Few cars, even fewer who would take us. Almost everyone was local, going to shop dinner at one of the hamburger places. Finally got a ride after maybe 3-4 hours of desperate searches.
I had very good luck here! Got a local driver who took me to Link√∂ping and drove me for the next good spot! Its all about attitude :)
I was so f--king annoying! Only local traffic and truck on the pause.
I was so f--king annoying! Only local traffic.

Looks like a perfect spot. 
Lot of German and Dutch tourist. Mot of van and camping car. Lot of east Europe trucs. So good conditions to go far. 
But i was unlucky. I ask everyone for 1h30 with very bad result. Finally got a ride to the next Big gasstation that's looks even better.

camping in the woods near the lake is very nice, but there was nearly no traffic at the petrol station, so i had to walk down to the highway.. but cars are mostly too fast to stop (and it's illegal to stand there), after a hour i got a ride to j√∂nk√∂ping.

we sat at the petrol station,1 car in 20minutes, it was already dark, thinking about a night in the forest (which had been really cold in february) and then a car stopped. he just said "stockholm?" and we were fell into his arms and hugged each other
i've been standing there for 4hours and noone stopped. guess it depends on the time guess it would have been better in summer (i was lifting there in oktober...)

maybe one of the best places I ever tryed out. slow traffic, directly coming from the petrol station and enough place for carstop...

2 minutes until a direct ride to stockholm.
Took me 45 min to get a lift to Norrk√∂ping.
Got here in rainy October looking for place south for three. Found one heading for Malm√∂ in just 30 minutes just by asking people coming to get gas.

Asked people at the gasstations and found a nice couple that brought me to the ferry in Malm√∂.
Probably luck though.
tried in summer 2011, and find a direct ride to stockholm here!

Big service point with gasstaion, hamburgerplaces hotel etc, but not a good spot to stand at the exit. Gasstion is not so big, and was not so busy when i was there. Walk to the highway and try the ramp instead.

Quite many cars and easy to get in contact with people. However, most were avoidant and / or said that they are heading south (not sure how true this is though). We were there around lunchtime and walked around between the petrol station, the e-car charging place and the big parking in front of MAX. Probably a good spot, but it seems generally hard to brake the Swedish ice. But - we were lucky in the end!
Lot of space to stop the car, but it¬¥s still before the road splits. Much safer though than the very entrance to the highway, if you¬¥re heading north. (09.2014)

Whatever you do, do NOT allow your driver to let you off here. This spot is senseless. No one even took the time to stop, even with a sign saying STH everyone looked at me as if I was an idiot. First time I had to give up hitchhiking and take a train.
Excellent place to get a lift to south direction. It took around 3-4 minutes. And in the meanwhile, I was even offered a ride to G√§vle.
I agree that It's difficult, I was offered a ride to G√§vle (north) after 40 minutes, before that only rides to STHLM.

Gas station: mainly inner-swedish traffic.
Roadside: not easy to stop and direction of strag unpredictable (round-about)
Got a 2 ppl ride over to CPH airport from a taxi driver after 2 hours
Got there from Rastplats Lockarp located more eastern. Not a good spot towards north. Cars are mostly going to Copenhagen and if going north, they're filled with baggage thus unable to take you.
Waited about 1.5 hours in the late evening, but finally got a ride from a nice danish couple.

We were three guys hitchhiking to Copenhagen, we came here right after sunrise, it was Saturday, not a lot of cars were passing by, but we managed to take a hike in 40 minutes. We used sign "DK". Cars can easily stop here.
got droped of here in the night, camped for the night and hitched a ride half way to g√∂teborg in the morning within 5 min.

Some middle east immigrants took me, but then they asked me for a money for a ride. I talked with them about idea of hitchhiking and asked them to leave me in first safe spot 20km from Umea. Misunderstanding, but it was respectful from both sides.
Got lucky with a ride to nordmaling in 5 minutes, but the conditions are not good. Lot of traffic, barely any safe space to stop.
In August a very good stop, people see you from the roundabout and there is some space to stand/stop

Tried both the famous "truck stopping" that was empty at midday as well as the roundabout here, which is just not gonna work, high speeds, very uncomfortable, early april was snow/mud splattered across the side, just ended up taking a farmersroad to a better spot, here i doubt you can get a ride to south

Monday morning. 
The place is ok. No tourist but easy tkbget a ride until one of the Big rest area /gasstation that are a bit further south.
Could be more traffic, but at least all the cars here head in the right direction. Imo lots of space for cars to stop.
got a ride straight to Malm√∂ after 30min of waiting. not too much space to pull over but cars go slowly and you will be visible.
towards south (Malm√∂, Helsingborg etc). There's some space to stop on the on ramp to the highway.
If you go north - it's just a beautiful spot for you. Dozens of cars and tracks going to Stockholm

1st experience - got a ride to Norrkoping after around 1h. 2nd experience on the way south - lot of traffic going just to Jonkoping, got one offer, but only to there and thus, rejected it. We camped in a nearby playground and on the following day after a lot of waiting eventually accepted a ride to Jonkoping.

Came in the evening just as it was getting dark. Few cars and none would take us. Spent the night outside and got a ride in the morning by someone who worked at the gas station. Huskvarna or J√∂nk√∂ping is much better, so try to get dropped off there instead.
A motel (V√§tterleden motell) and a 24/7 gas station with bathrooms. Trucks gather on the other side of the street.
I think they moved the bus stop in the meantime so there is no place to wait here
bus stop, quite a good place to get a ride northwest towards E14.
Waited quite long. I had many options to go north (Oslo) but only a few cars were going south.
Southwards: Not much space for cars to stop and almost no traffic. All cars are Norwegians going north. Waited a couple of hours and got a ride to G√∂teborg.
fewer cars than expected. got a long ride to helsinborg though
Few cars but got a ride to Helsingborg within 20 minutes.
for going south. worked better for me than the gasstation.
a lot of cars but not a lot of space to stop
Nice ramp on the E22 road. Enough place for cars to stay. I got a short lift towards Bergkvara on my way to Stockholm
Weird spot and recently rebuilt, barely a road anymore.
Despite the above opinion, I would recommend this place to be best for going Northbound. The experience of ca. 50 odd hikes caught there, waiting time is ca. 2-10 min. Good luck!

It might be better to go to Lund and start again if your in it for the long-haul.  ill try again and post another one.

Decent spot, a lot of people are locals, but I got a ride 50km south on the E4 relatively quickly. Standing on the side of the road works since cars are slow coming from the roundabout and they have some space to pull over, even if its not too much.

Some space beside the road to let cars stop going South on E4. Fairly slow traffic.

Towards Trelleborg, 1 hour
We, 2 guys heading for Trelleborg. Two nice Iraqi guys took us. Waiting time ~15min.

This spot is also good to go north despite other spots in the north of Ume√• might be more convenients

waited one hour for a ride to √ñrebro, 2guys and a girl hitch hiking
Waited 45 minutes for a ride 40km towards Stockholm. (two guys hitchhiking)
Stand here for heading east to Stockholm. Room for cars to pull over, but traffic was light.  One car every minute or two.

Tried to go south. Lots of cars but few that stops. High speeds and we didn't seem appreciated here, lots of honking. It was evening time, and a lot seemed to take the highway to other parts of Link√∂ping or closeby towns. Two cars stopped in two hours, both of them heading to nearby towns.

Cars are fast and most of them that go to J√∂nk√∂ping/Helsingborg drive on the left side. The right shoulder isn't very long and wide.

If you're going southwards this is a really good place.. 
I have used it several times

Spot looks nice with a big right shoulder but cars accelerate to 90 km/h here. Make sure you have a big sign and people see you early.

I had to move to the other spot near the IKEA.

Bad place to go. Most traffic seems to be local. I went over the motorway to the other side and stood directly at the beginning of the motorway, but I still waited for four hours or so.

Since the gas station is not one of the mayor ones, most people going here are locals from Marieberg or Adolfsberg. Crazy bad spot which after 3 hr of waiting rendered me having to pick up the bus back into town.
People going North or south on the motor way can access this gas station. The first car I asked took me all the way to Gothenburg.
All that road is good lesson of patience and calmness, almost no cars at all

Difficult spot. Very low traffic (1 car / 5 min) and hardly anyone going long distance. Very windy too, but there‚Äôs a shelter so worst case you can sleep in there. Was taken to the next city to catch a public bus to Umea.

after over 3 hours a car stopped and offered to take us to Tran√•s. this was around noon. Once we left Sweden we never had to wait nearly this long anywhere, so all i can say is, Sweden really sucks for hitchhiking
BEST SPOT IF GOING SOUTH. There is a perfect spot for cars to spot before the road (E4). Please go here and trust me.
the bus stops are really good in norrk√∂ping. recommend when going towards stockholm
i would recommend the bus stops in the city going east.
pretty ok. a lot of cars go by but unfortunately the ‚Äújantelov‚Äù is too important and practiced by the swedes to help strangers.
good waiting spot and a lot of cars drive by
really good hitch-place. theres a restaurant, a gas station, aswell as a motel and hotel. got a ride before putting my finger out
worst shit in the fucking world dont ever fucking come here and weird people shut the fuck up

South/summer/day/2peopel

--> i think it's better to go a bit further, almost on the highway. There i larger area to stop and cars only going to cph.
I hitchhiked on a Saturday. There wasn't so much traffic. The gas station doesnt work. I tried to ask people there but nobody went to Copenhagen from there.

Solo men, july 2023, sunny monday morning.

5:- for a hot dog in Ikea. Couldn't miss that. Went on this spot to go further North. It was not very good (no confortable place to stop for cars). But after 15min peoples stop and it was fine.

Not perfect but it was ok

The trucks seem to be very spread out over this terminal that is not very welcoming for visitors, but there is some traffic going in and out.

Ollebo Terminalen T√ºrkiyeden gelen veya T√ºrkiyeye giden tƒ±rlarƒ±n √ßoƒüunluƒüunun g√ºmr√ºk i≈ülerini yaptƒ±rdƒ±ƒüƒ± bir g√ºmr√ºk merkezidir. Burada park halindeki tƒ±rlarƒ±n ≈üof√∂rleriyle tanƒ±≈üƒ±p uzun mesafeli otostop √ßekme ≈üansƒ±nƒ±zƒ± arttƒ±rabilirsiniz.
Waited for maybe 30-35 min, when I was just about to give up a guy stopped and gave me a ride to Karlshamn.

Got a ride 10-15 further along the highway after waiting for 20-25 min
Possible to hick-hike up on the highway with cars comming from the roundabout. Not a lot of traffic and there's room for a car to stop.
I was waiting there and asking for a lift to Link owing direction, but there were people at the local traffic, going to jobs mostly.
i will find out soon! theres a petrol station, ill try it in a couple of days and will let you know

Dir south

Good spot where cars can pull over just after the bridge. DO NOT walk further down the road, theres nothing there!
All right, but not really tons of space to pull over.

This spot is all right, not great though. Do not accept rides to Koge, you'll be stuck there.
Cars are fast, but there is a bus stop where they can stop.
Not too much traffic, but a lot of space. Should work fine.
Cars are fast, but they have a lot of space to pull over. Not too bad.
Rather little space to stand, it is allright though.
We just hitched to the next service area from here. A lot of space to pull over. Since the next service area on the highway is just 2 km away it does not matter, that there is mostly local traffic.
Basically unused shoulder from the parking lot. Enough space to stop, many cars go to the mall North though
Already on the highway, not too comfortable for drivers to stop. Two lanes and half one beside

Not the very best spot. Started to walk from Isaberg, in hope to find a better spot. Bad move by me. Took around 2 hours to get a car. The cars drives around 90km/h here so I really think that Isaberg is the best.

Not many cars, even though close proximity to gas station. 20-30 minutes to find a ride up North to G√§vle.
not so much cars, hard to find a ride
Few cars. Tried it for a 30 minutes then walked back to the Liseberg onramp.
got a ride towards malmo after 5 mins. There's a huge parking deck & an amusement park so quite a few cars going. plus the curve is very narrow so it's easy to stop the cars :)

The place itself seems really good, there's space for cars to pullover. However we waited for a long time to get a ride anywhere south (even to Sandsj√∂backa gas station). Waited for a couple of hours at different areas around Liseberg. Granted there is a lot of traffic, but most of it is local. If you go towards the onramp, there is no good place for cars to stop.
If you're stupid enough to hh in Sweden then this might be a good spot

There¬¥s a small gas station here. We wanted to hitchhike from this spot but there were already some hitchhikers there who¬¥ve been standing there for 2 hours. We walked along the road and found another, not very safe spot, where we got a ride in 10 minutes.(as of August 2014, the area around here was under construction, lots of traffic jam which only got better around the next spot where we stood)

Kapellsk√§r is just a ferry terminal, so the only traffic you¬¥ll have is cars coming from the ferry + workers. Hurry on your way out of the ferry, since the cars leave quite quickly. Got a ride to Norrt√§lje with a worker in the terminal.
From the roundabout, there are two entrances for the cars going north. None of them is really perfect, but we had more luck on this on-ramp with a very tiny margin.
Direction Stockholm.

I had a hard time finding a good place to hitchhike from Halmstad, even though I checked here before. After asking five or six locals for tips and trying out a few places to stand, I found that the easiest spot was to stand about 20 meters from the traffic light on the crossing of Ryttarev√§gen and Laholmsv√§gen. Drivers were able to see the sign, make up their mind, and have a chance to slow down before taking the exit onto the highway. I had a sign that said "Snapparp" and got a ride in 10-15 mi

A spot to stand by the road that leads up to the ramp to the highway which is going south towards Malm√∂. There is both time and a little space where cars can pull in and pick you up. Have a sign! Ideally towards "Snapparp" (a few miles down the highway) where there's a petrol station and a much better place to ask around for rides further south.

I was to optimist and tried to catch a ride to Copenhagen. Although it was Tuesday in the very morning, most people were staying in town and working or going just next to Lund. If you try to catch a ride just towards Malm√∂ and from there further to Copenhagen you will have much more luck! It went far better.
Gas station before the highway E22 towards Malm√∂, Copenhagen.
We wanted to spare money so we haven't took the bus to Sjorek national park. By the time we almost thought we won't be able to get there by hike, we succeed. Visibility is great, density poor.

Even though cars are running pretty fast and there are two lines we managed to get a ride in hour. We found it very hard to get a hike from Sundsvall - standing at the edge of highway is almost impossible. We took a bus to Stocvick and took a bath in sea - there is really nice beach.
Hitchhiked to Norway (on a Sunday). Very easy since many Norwegians are going home after spending the day/weekend in √ñstersund.

Tried hitching west along the E14 from here at dusk in Oct 2013, people were only going short distances though. After two hours I accepted a lift a short way west just to get out of there! If you're thinking of hitching west on e14 it could be a good idea to do it on Sunday, lots of Norwegians come over the border for the weekend to put their purchasing power to good use and then go back on Sunday.
Summer, weekday, female single traveller. I stood there by chance, first car stopped after ca 15mins. 8am in morning, weekday!!! It is possible to get rides there.

direction east/sollefte√É¬•. well it's basically at the sideways and there's not much traffic on this road. there's a bus that takes you nearby. did it once and took me only 10 minutes for a ride - so i guess it's allright.
Try to avoid this place, cars go over 100 although the crossroads is huge. However, lots of space to stop for cars. Youll get a ride anyway. Daytime, Summer, female single traveller
Not many traffic and no place to stop for cars, but relative safe because cars coming from behind see stopping cars early.

To get down the 49 this is the best spot, because cars are slow here and coming from both directions of the 50. There's a big parking lot, something like a bus stop, but also not very much traffic, maybe 10 cars a hour.
we (two guys) arrived here at 6pm and waited 'till dark. tried again next morning with no luck. We eventually left around lunch.
Good spot towards Kristianstad
I was standing next to Connect Hotel, preparing "Malmo" sign, when a lady came to me and asked where did I want to go. So nice! Though they gave me a ride only to Nykopping.
Together with my girlfriend, we got a ride to Stockholm. We stayed very close to the entrance of Connect Hotel. Took us about 30min.
the place is √ñlme, and is indeed very usable for hiking east.

Somewhere (not entirely sure where exactly) on this road there is a gas station where losts of cars from BOTH directions stop. Also trucks, but most traffic going to Oslo when i was there (morning at 10am). You can ask the ppl at the gas station and as well stand next to the road, as visibility is ok (on top of a hill and speed is not that high (70). I waited about 30min until somebody picked me up and by coincidence he drove all the way to Stockholm.

After I've tried the previous point I decide to move forward because there were a lot of d.heads that whistle me because they go on the right... so I did an nice card big and I get a ride after 15 minutes until LandsKorona (the next point big gas station) I think I was lucky
At the small bus-stop in front of Mcdonalds i waited for about 20minutes Before i got a ride about 5km to "Varberg Nord" from where it¬¥s quite easy to get a ride South or North.

Made the mistake to get dropped off here going south. No cars at all. If you go off here then at least go with the driver to Traryd at road 120. From there is a road to another on-ramp where the southbound traffic goes.
Found a ride to Boras after 2hrs.
petrol station Herrbeta north, direction Denmark. Most people seemed to go only to Linnk√∂ping.

I was hitching from here back to Norway and it went pretty good. But that depends on when you are travelling. I had lot of people going back home from Easter holidays who has cabins around here. Otherwise there are probably mainly locals ...

Direction: Norway

Enough place to stop and cars are slow from the junction ...

we just stand there looking after the 3 cars driving there in 30minutes. but then the best guy stopped over. they have time to think because they see you while driving to the gas station and then afterwards. there's enough space to stop!

(Winter / Daytime / Direction E4 South) Busy petrol station so you might get rides there, also next to the roundabout there is a bus stop where cars might stop, it took us many hours before someone at the petrol station decided to take us to another spot to keep on looking for a ride.

(Winter - Direction E4 South) The Shell petrol station is open 24 hours and has Wifi for free, also some computers with maps to check, very useful. The place itself might be good as 1,5km up the road is the E4, but we got a ride to another place in the city to get a ride easily.

(Winter) Direction South-West. Some people will drop you here stating this is the E10, but in fact this is the old E10, so you might want to walk a bit to the real one to get the rides, but anyways this Statoil petrol station is very busy and it took us about an hour or two to get a ride till T√∂re (where E10 and E4 meet in the coast)

One of the worst places I've ever tried to hitchhike from. When I stood near the road, I saw 3 middle fingers and even one plastic bottle was thrown at me. Terrible place, before Kalix I thought Scandinavian people are kind and civilized...

Truckstop and fuelingstation with a shop and restaurant here. In the summer there are alot of tourists stopping here. All year around there are quite alot of trucks. Great view over the sea too.

It took about 1 hour to get a lift ... I didn't have a sign, but I figured it was obvious which direction I was traveling.  You can get cardboard at the petrol stop across the motorway .... but when I was there it was wet from some rain the night before, which is why I didn't have a sign.
Good position, but cars to south were rare on sunday morning.
Nothing special, just a road junction - stay off the marked highways.

West: It's not a bad place since both the cars coming from the city and from the E10 can see you and stop, but most of them are still local traffic, so I would rather suggest to walk a couple of km down the E10

This spot worked well in 2006, but I have the feeling I was lucky. Difficult to reach.
http://hitchwiki.org/en/Uppsala
Going south, this is the last gas station before Helsingborg, but actually a crappy place. Too far from the motorway, shop closing at 6PM already, few traffic.

This is one spot for going south on E6/E20. Perhaps a bit too close to the center -- many cars are probably not leaving the city. Though a friend got a ride straight to Malm√É¬∂. There are indeed red lights, so you can get contact with people.

You can get here by taking a tram to stop called Stampen, and walking Gullbergsvassgatan.

Heading South from center over bridge past the roundabout to bus stop. Room for them to stop, all E4 traffic going south goes past here.

Cars have a high speed and depending on time of day they may not be many. I waited for 20 min.

two petrolstations, statoil and OKQ8. Alot of cars, many of them heading north for example Stockholm. Hitched from here twice with no problems. Close walk from central Norrk√É¬∂ping and the centralstation is always positive.
pull-off, restarea and petrolstation. sounds like the perfect place to find hitch but i took over 20 minutes to get ride from here to √É¬∂rebro.

Go by bus from Nils Ericsson-terminalen/G√É¬∂teborg Central to Delsj√É¬∂motet and position yourself along the side of the road leading out of town with a J√É‚ÄìNK√É‚ÄìPING-sign.
